title: Showers above 50mm expected in parts of Sri Lanka today
byline: Several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy and Nuwara-Eliya districts today (27), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Iran says no plan for new US nuclear talks
byline: Iran has denied it is set to resume nuclear talks with the United States after the end of a 12-day war with Israel, and accused Washington of exaggerating the impact of US strikes.

title: Ex-South African President praises AKD for efforts on unity & economic reform
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake met with former President of the Republic of South Africa, Thabo Mbeki, last afternoon (26) at the Presidential Secretariat.

title: UN Rights Chief Volker Türk concludes official visit to Sri Lanka
byline: The United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk has concluded his four-day official visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Uni. student reported missing while swimming at Colombo Port City beach
byline: A 24-year-old youth has been reported missing while swimming in the sea off the artificial beach at Colombo Port City, said police.

title: Govt urged to intervene and resolve J’pura external degrees unit issues
byline: All academic activities at the External Degrees and Extension Courses Unit of the University of Sri Jayewardenepura have been temporarily suspended.

title: Derailment disrupts train operations on Upcountry Line
byline: Train operations on the Upcountry railway line have been disrupted following the derailment of a train at the Rambukkana railway station.

title: Krrish Project: Colombo HC adjourns case against Namal Rajapaksa
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered the re-convening of the case filed by the Attorney General against Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa on September 26.

title: Indian investigators download black box data from fatal Air India crash
byline: Investigators have downloaded flight recorder data from an Air India crash this month that killed 260 people, India’s civil aviation ministry said on Thursday, a long-awaited step towards understanding the world’s worst aviation disaster in a decade.

title: 500,000 students and 150,000 teachers to benefit from World Bank education funding
byline: An estimated 500,000 students and 150,000 teachers across Sri Lanka are set to benefit from a new $50 million additional financing package approved by the World Bank yesterday (26) through its ongoing General Education Modernization Project.

title: Xiaomi billionaire Lei Jun challenges Elon Musk with hot new SUV
byline: Lei Jun, the billionaire cofounder of Chinese tech giant Xiaomi, launched an electric SUV that could be a strong competitor to Tesla’s Model Y in China, which sent Xiaomi’s Hong Kong-listed shares as much as 8% higher on Friday.

title: Police warn of rising social media-based financial scams targeting Sri Lankans
byline: Sri Lanka Police has issued a public warning following a surge in financial crimes targeting Sri Lankan citizens through various social media platforms, including Facebook, WhatsApp, Telegram, Skype, and WeChat.

title: Two NPP members reportedly abducted ahead of Weligama PS vote
byline: It has been reported that two members of the National People’s Power (NPP) party were allegedly abducted while on their way to cast their votes to elect the Chairman of the Weligama Pradeshiya Sabha today (27).

title: Ex-SriLankan Airlines chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe arrested
byline: Former Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, Nishantha Wickramasinghe, has been arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: ‘Twitter killer’ who murdered nine hanged in Japan’s first execution since 2022
byline: Japan has executed a man who killed nine people after contacting them on social media, the first use of capital punishment in the country in nearly three years.

title: Former Chairman of Ceylon Fisheries Harbour Corp. arrested
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release on bail of former Chairman of the Ceylon Fisheries Harbour Corporation (CFHC), Upali Liyanage, who was arrested by the Bribery Commission on corruption charges.

title: Corruption charges against ex-SriLankan Airlines chairman revealed
byline: Former Chairman of SriLankan Airlines, Nishantha Wickramasinghe, was arrested this afternoon by officers of the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).
